result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaquille L Godwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs. Pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges, during term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail applied. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. Cash bail applies.
- Restitution set at zero.

- No contact with weapons. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
- No further violations of the law rising to probable cause.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Stay on all prescribed medications.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- Maintain full time employment or attend school.
- Obtain high school diploma.
- No Contact with T.A.S and Reginald Tracy.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shaquille L Godwin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 9/30/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Shaquille L Godwin in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  Additional statements by Shelly T. 

As to Count 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 years,  with credit for 54 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 years; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 years.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
- No further violations of the law rising to probable cause. 
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Stay on all prescribed medications.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or  treatment deemed appropriate.
- Maintain full time employment or attend school.  
-Obtain high school diploma.
- No contact with T.A.S and Reginald Tracy.
- No contact with weapons. 
- Restitution set at zero. 
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges, during term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in civil judgment.  Any bail on deposit to apply. 

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  

If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Shaquille L Godwin in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court addressed the violation report dated 8/17/15 and 8/28/15.  Court withdraws the bench warrant.  Case adjourned to previously set court date of sentencing hearing in Br. 19 on 9/24/15 at 1:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court.  Ronald Dague appeared Patrick Anderson for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court addressed violation reports of 8/17/15 and 8/28/15.  Defendant had been escorted to court by JusticePoint and the defendant is now no longer in court.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court does not forfeit any bail at this time.  Case remains calendered for sentencing in Br. 19 on 9/24/15 at 1:30 pm.
JusticePoint violation report, received and filed.   Court defers action.

Defendant Shaquille L Godwin in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and elements received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant to provide an DNA sample.
Court orders a PSI report.  

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Shaquille L Godwin not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference and bail review.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES defense motion for bail reduction.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shaquille L Godwin in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Shaquille L Godwin in custody.  Ronald Dague for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESING.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BIG LOTS AND ANDREW M.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shaquille L Godwin in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
